title: Bayonetta
notes: After title screen, have to press down to select "Start new game" (credits selected by default) Selection cursor is not visible.  Game runs smooth at default settings chosen by game (2560x1440, medium settings).  Tested mouse and keyboard input through the first fight, cinematics OK.  Game locked when trying to change graphic settings (attempted to bump to "High").

title: Bayonetta
notes: Gameplay is fine but it's a little crash-prone on scene transitions. I did run into the other tester's issue with title screen selection but inconsistently. XBox 360 controller works great including rumble.

title: Bayonetta
notes: Runs Great. Tested with Keyboard and Mouse

title: Bayonetta
notes: No issues

title: Bayonetta
notes: Upon saving a graphics configuration, a WINE error appeared saying that the file could not be written to. The title screen then froze.

title: Bayonetta
notes:
Game will launch and play without any noticeable flaws. Dualshock 4 controller connected via bluetooth worked fine and was set up automatically through Steam.

If any settings are changed, an error message displays saying it is unable to save. Game can only be launched once, after which it will black screen on every further attempt to launch. Deleting the games config file in ~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/460790/pfx allows the game to launch again.

Tested at both 720p and 1080p in windowed and fullscreen modes.

title: Bayonetta
notes: Game works but if you try to change any of the settings, the game crashes and the next time the game launches with a black screen.

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.5-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Gameplay is OK, completed prologue without problems. X360 controller works and is detected correctly. Performance is acceptable on default settings (medium) at 1440p. Steam overlay appears to be graphically corrupted. Touching video options ingame will crash the game instantly (does not save settings), and touching video options in title screen will cause game to crash when you start new game or load save (saves settings). When changed settings are saved, game shows error box about not being able to save config and any further attemps to start game will fail (window with a black screen). This can be fixed by removing (configuration from) Proton prefix. However, default settings seem to be just fine as there are no video or controller issues and game is playable and stable, you just lack the high quality preset.
title: Bayonetta

gpu: ATI Technologies Inc. AMD Radeon HD 7900 Series
notes:
20 FPS @ High @ 1080 with AMD r9 280x (hd7900 rebrand)
About settings freezing: it's freezes when you confirm any setting, just alt+tab or toggle desktop to  lookup for a small warning window, close/confirm this window and the game will resume(in window mode, alt+enter for full-screen)

notes: The game started well, but the controller was not recognized (BLUETOOTH HID v9.03 Gamepad [Xbox Wireless Controller] ). I started the game but few minutes the game closed it self. title: Bayonetta

notes: As far as graphics, even with d3d11, things like character models and the falling debris in the intro would not load in (you could see things like hit effects, the sigils on said debris, Bayo's mouth, eyes, and glasses) Biggest issue though, is that the game will often fail to save things like graphics changes. This failure causes the game to freeze until you close the prompt.
title: Bayonetta

notes: Cannot save settings to play in windowed mode. If you do so the game refuses to start again.
title: Bayonetta

notes: Runs fine, but changing settings in the options menu causes game to crash and can make it unbootable.  Delete Bayonetta folder in My Documents in the Proton prefix if game becomes unbootable.
title: Bayonetta

notes: The game launches but hangs or crashes frequently. Graphical options are stuck in medium settings, any change will cause game to hang and prevent to start again. You'll have to delete "system_data" file in prefix folder: ../steamuser/MyDocuments/Bayonetta/ to be able to launch it. There also are a lot a visual glitches here and there.  Menu for save/load is not reachable, it does hang the game. Not playable right now.
title: Bayonetta

notes: You need disable Esync and DX11 to game run without hangs or texture issues. To this, use this config in launch options: PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%
title: Bayonetta

notes: Ran perfectly but upon trying to autosave it crashed, disabled autosaves and was able to continue past the point of crash.
title: Bayonetta
